alert.note: Alert for Craig; Ottawa (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Heat Advisory issued July 23 at 2:08PM CDT until July 23 at 8:00PM CDT by NWS Tulsa
info.description: ...HEAT ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 8 PM CDT THIS EVENING... ...HEAT ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 1 PM TO 8 PM CDT SUNDAY... ...HEAT ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 1 PM TO 8 PM CDT MONDAY... * WHAT...Dangerous heat with heat index values between 106 and 109 expected this afternoon thru Monday. * WHERE...Craig and Ottawa Counties. * WHEN...thru 8 PM CDT this evening, and again from 1 PM to 8 PM Sunday and Monday. * IMPACTS...Hot temperatures and high humidity will combine to create a dangerous situation in which heat illnesses are possible.
info.instruction: Take extra precautions if you work or spend time outside. When possible, reschedule strenuous activities to early morning or evening. Know the signs and symptoms of heat exhaustion and heat stroke. Wear light weight and loose fitting clothing when possible and drink plenty of water. To reduce risk during outdoor work the occupational safety and health administration recommends scheduling frequent rest breaks in shaded or air conditioned environments. Anyone overcome by heat should be moved to a cool and shaded location. Heat stroke is an emergency, call 911.
